verses.text: "JESUS_START" Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And five of them were wise, and five were foolish. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" They that were foolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" While the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And at midnight there was a cry made, Behold, the bridegroom cometh; go ye out to meet him. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are gone out. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" But the wise answered, saying, Not so; lest there be not enough for us and you: but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage: and the door was shut. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh. "JESUS_END"
Â¶ "JESUS_START" For the kingdom of heaven is as a man travelling into a far country, who called his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and straightway took his journey. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same, and made them other five talents. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And likewise he that had received two, he also gained other two. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" But he that had received one went and digged in the earth, and hid his lord's money. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" After a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and reckoneth with them. "JESUS_END"

"JESUS_START" And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: behold, I have gained beside them five talents more. "JESUS_END"

"JESUS_START" His lord said unto him, Well done, thou good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" He also that had received two talents came and said, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: behold, I have gained two other talents beside them. "JESUS_END"

"JESUS_START" His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord. "JESUS_END"

"JESUS_START" Then he which had received the one talent came and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art an hard man, reaping where thou hast not sown, and gathering where thou hast not strawed: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, there thou hast that is thine. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" His lord answered and said unto him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I have not strawed: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers, and then at my coming I should have received mine own with usury. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Take therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him which hath ten talents. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth. "JESUS_END"
Â¶ "JESUS_START" When the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And before him shall be gathered all nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" For I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fed thee? or thirsty, and gave thee drink? "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" When saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed thee? "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee? "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" For I was an hungred, and ye gave me no meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink: "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" I was a stranger, and ye took me not in: naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Then shall they also answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee? "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not to me. "JESUS_END"
"JESUS_START" And these shall go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal. "JESUS_END"
